intro: Allium baekdusanense, commonly known as the Baekdusan garlic, is a rare and endemic plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous structure and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers arranged in a dense umbel, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
